American College of Radiology. PI-RADS. Retrieved from https://www.acr.org/Clinical-Resources/Reporting-and-Data-Systems/PI-RADS.
Turkbey, B., Rosenkrantz, A. B., Haider, M. A., Padhani, A. R., Villeirs, G., Macura, K. J., Tempany, C. M., Choyke, P. L., Cornud, F., Margolis, D. J., Thoeny, H. C., Verma, S., Barentsz, J., & Weinreb, J. C. (2019). Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System Version 2.1: 2019 Update of Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System Version 2. European Urology, 76(3), 340-351. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1016/j.eururo.2019.02.033

details.purpose: For å registrere PI-RADS v2.1 klassifiseringen.
details.keywords: PI-RADS, prostatakreft, bilde-rapportering, mpMRI, standardisert, vurderingskategorier, lesjoner, klinisk signifikant, radiolog, urolog, MR prostata
details.use:
Brukes for å registrere PI-RADS v2.1 klassifiseringen.
Denne arketypen er designet for å være nøstet inn i en relevant CLUSTER-arketype, der én instans av denne arketypen brukes til å registrere PI-RADS klassifiseringen for hvert unormalt område identifisert i prostata.
Per dags dato finnes det ingen validert norsk oversettelse av verktøyet. Man har derfor i arketypen valgt å beholde orginalspråk for dataelementene. Om det på et tidspunkt etableres en validert norsk oversettelse, vil arketypen oppdateres med denne.
details.misuse: Brukes ikke til å registrere noen versjon av PI-RADS-klassifiseringen annet enn versjon 2.1. For slike formål, bruk arketypene som er designet for hver spesifik versjon av PI-RADS.

details.purpose: To record the PI-RADS v2.1 classification.
details.keywords: PI-RADS, prostate cancer, imaging-reporting, mpMRI, standarized, assessment categories, lesions, clinically significant, radiologists, urologists, MR prostate
details.use:
Use to record the PI-RADS v2.1 classification.
This archetype is designed to be nested within a relevant CLUSTER archetype, using one instance of this archetype to record the PI-RADS classification for each abnormal area identified in the prostate.
details.misuse: Not to be used to record any version of the PI-RADS classification other than version 2.1. For these purposes, use archetypes designed for each specific version of PI-RADS.

items.items: PI-RADS v2.1
En klassifisering av et unormalt område identifisert ved mpMRI (multi-parametrisk magnetisk resonansavbildning) av prostata.
PI-RADS - Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System.
PI-RADS
Very low
Clinically significant cancer is highly unlikely to be present.
Low
Clinically significant cancer is unlikely to be present.
Intermediate
The presence of clinically significant cancer is equivocal.
High
Clinically significant cancer is likely to be present.
Very high
Clinically significant cancer is highly likely to be present.
PI-RADS v2.1
A classification of an abnormal area identified on mpMRI (multi-parametric magnetic resonance imaging) examination of the prostate.
PI-RADS - Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System.
PI-RADS
Very low
Clinically significant cancer is highly unlikely to be present.
Low
Clinically significant cancer is unlikely to be present.
Intermediate
The presence of clinically significant cancer is equivocal.
High
Clinically significant cancer is likely to be present.
Very high
Clinically significant cancer is highly likely to be present.
